class.name: InterruptedIOException
class.javadoc: Signals that an I/O operation has been interrupted. An InterruptedIOException is thrown to indicate that an input or output transfer has been terminated because the thread performing it was interrupted. The field {@link #bytesTransferred}indicates how many bytes were successfully transferred before the interruption occurred. unascribed java.io.InputStream java.io.OutputStream java.lang.Thread#interrupt() JDK1.0
Constructs an InterruptedIOException with null as its error detail message.

Constructs an InterruptedIOException with the specified detail message. The string s can be retrieved later by the {@link java.lang.Throwable#getMessage} method of class java.lang.Throwable. s the detail message.
Reports how many bytes had been transferred as part of the I/O operation before it was interrupted.
